alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Canyon Ferry Area; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Helena Valley; Meagher County Valleys; Missouri Headwaters (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 11 at 2:45PM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and southwest Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
